newsitem.title: UK: Euro vegoils lack fresh direction, mixed values.
newsitem.headline: Euro vegoils lack fresh direction, mixed values.

text.p: European vegetable oil selling levels were mixed at midday as the market lacked fresh direction, trader said.
During the morning session the only trades reported were in the palm oil sector with $527.50 paid for Aug crude palm oil and $555 for Aug olein.

Crop forecaster Ivan Wong's estimates for Malaysian June palm oil output at 783,000 tonnes, end-June palm oil stocks at 770,000 tonnes and June exports of 615,000 tonnes against 626,606 in May, were seen as neutral to the market.
At midday palm oils were $2.50 either side of Thursday's close, although values could fall further if the market decides to follow the trend set on Malaysian palm oil futures.
Potential buyers of palm oil material were reportedly lurking around $5 below asking prices.
Soft oils at midday were unchanged to 0.25 guilders down, while lauric oils were unchanged to $5 firmer.
